verses.text_plain: Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.
verses.verse_html:
1Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble. ▼
▼ few…: Heb. short of days

footnotes.body_html: ▼ few…: Heb. short of days

verses.text_plain: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.
verses.verse_html: 2He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.

verses.text_plain: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?
verses.verse_html: 3And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?

verses.text_plain: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.
verses.verse_html:
4Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one. ▼
▼ can…: Heb. will give

footnotes.body_html: ▼ can…: Heb. will give

verses.text_plain: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;
verses.verse_html: 5Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;

verses.text_plain: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.
verses.verse_html:
6Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day. ▼
▼ rest: Heb. cease

tokens.text: from him, that he may rest

verses.text_plain: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.
verses.verse_html: 7For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.

verses.text_plain: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;
verses.verse_html: 8Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;

verses.text_plain: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.
verses.verse_html: 9Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.

verses.text_plain: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?
verses.verse_html:
10But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he? ▼
▼ wasteth…: Heb. is weakened, or, cut off

footnotes.body_text: ▼ wasteth…: Heb. is weakened, or, cut off
footnotes.body_html: ▼ wasteth…: Heb. is weakened, or, cut off

verses.text_plain: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:
verses.verse_html: 11As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:

verses.text_plain: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.
verses.verse_html: 12So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.

verses.text_plain: O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!
verses.verse_html: 13O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!

tokens.text: that thou wouldest keep me secret

verses.text_plain: If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.
verses.verse_html: 14If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.

verses.text_plain: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.
verses.verse_html: 15Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.

tokens.text: thee: thou wilt have a desire

verses.text_plain: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?
verses.verse_html: 16For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?

verses.text_plain: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.
verses.verse_html: 17My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.

verses.text_plain: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.
verses.verse_html:
18And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place. ▼
▼ cometh…: Heb. fadeth

verses.text_plain: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.
verses.verse_html:
19The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man. ▼
▼ washest…: Heb. overflowest

verses.text_plain: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.
verses.verse_html: 20Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.

verses.text_plain: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.
verses.verse_html: 21His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.

tokens.text: not; and they are brought low

verses.text_plain: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
verses.verse_html: 22But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
